communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massachusetts AG EO 14190
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any communication, guidance documents, reports, memos or other records regarding the U.S. Attorney General coordinating with the Massachusetts Attorney General to comply with executive order 14190 ("Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling") by enforcing the law and filing appropriate actions against K-12 teachers and school officials who violate the law by:
(i) sexually exploiting minors;
(ii) unlawfully practicing medicine by offering diagnoses and treatment without the requisite license; or
(iii) otherwise unlawfully facilitating the social transition of a minor student.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine AG EO 14190
communications.communication:
I am the public access officer for the Office of Attorney General.  This email is to acknowledge your Freedom of Access Act request below.  Please note that your request may be denied in part or in whole to the extent responsive records are confidential by statute, within the scope of a privilege against discovery or use as evidence, or otherwise outside the definition of “public records” in 1 M.R.S. §402(3)<https://legislature.maine.gov/statutes/1/title1sec402.html>.

I am consulting with individuals in our office who may have records responsive to your request.  Either myself or someone with subject-matter knowledge relevant to your request will be in touch shortly with further information, including a time and cost estimate if necessary.

General information about the Freedom of Access Act may be found here<https://www.maine.gov/foaa/faq/index.shtml>.

Thank you,
Jon

[cid:image002.png@01DBAA2D.26843390]
Jonathan R. Bolton, AAG| Public Access Officer
Office of the Maine Attorney General
6 State House Station | Augusta, ME 04333
(207) 626-8551 (direct dial) | (207) 626-8800 (main office)
jonathan.bolton@maine.gov<http://maine.gov/> | www.maine.gov/ag<http://www.maine.gov/ag>

communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska AG EO 14190
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communication, guidance documents, reports, memos or other records regarding the U.S. Attorney General coordinating with the Alaska Attorney General to comply with executive order 14190 ("Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling") by enforcing the law and filing appropriate actions against K-12 teachers and school officials who violate the law by:

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007 & 2008.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I did not see any of these reports on the following website:  https://utsports.com/sports/2019/8/7/financial.aspx

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Documents for Stephen Coppola
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Stephen F. Coppola (AKA: Stefano, Steve, Steven, Stephan):

FBI File #240905.  
DOD: June 2, 1984  

Search Directions:

1. Please use Stephen’s FBI File #240905 as the starting place for your search. 

2. Further, please conduct a search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY. 

3. Also conduct an additional search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the following:

A. The  Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices

B. The Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, 

C. The Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, 

D. And the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, 

4. In the above searches please include:  Both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. 

5. Additionally, please conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. 

6. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. 

7. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

8. I have included a screenshot of a document about Stephen Copppla from  the former The Bureau of Narcotics (which morphed into the DEA). This screenshot verifies Coppola had an FBI file and the FBI file number is/or was : 240905. 

9. In the advent of a negative response please detail all efforts that were made to find these documents via the directions mentioned above.

The Bureau of Narcotics described Stephen as follows:

"He is a wholesaler and distributor of illicit alcohol in the Western NY area. Obtains narcotics from other Mafiosi in NYC and wholesales these drugs in the Buffalo area. Also engaged in smuggling contraband across the U.S. - Canadian border. His brother Salvatore (deceased) was  highly respected among the Mafia Hierarchy in Western NY-Southern Ontario area."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mob
